values: Firstly, I ♥ you! Thank you so much for the yellow rose :D And if anyone's interested and hasn't seen the site, you should check out pandora.com for lots of great music. You enter in a band name/song name and it finds 'similar' music you should like, and signing up for mooooooore is free. Today I did many embarrassing things and ate scrummy food. Oh and later I found out I walked around for I have no idea how long with blue lips. *shakes fist at blue drink* But it was worth it. Maybe. Mmmm, blue drink. I could go for another blue drink. But now it's time to search for some other animal icons, because cats are great, but what about the rest too?

Okay, recently I have not had a lot of things to say (well, I have, but not really interesting, and too drama queen-esque for my tastes and etc). I still don't. So instead how about some exerpts (I'll pretend/hope that's close to the real spelling) from a young girl's magazine:
  • When I woz eating dinner at my boyfriend's house I woz laughing + choked on my crush + now I have a massive bruise on my forehead. Doh! I know what you're thinking. How do you choke on a crush randomly? Unless it is some sort of drink, like Raspberry or Cranberry Crush. Well, sorry to spoil the novelty, but I actually just read the page wrong and blended two different excellent tales together.
  • I was wandering around TopShop the other day when I spotted a girl wearing a gorgeous pair of shoes. I was keen to get a closer look and wasn't watching where I was going when I crashed straight into a shop mirror, which sent me flying backwards into a clothes rail. The whole story implies no injury, so it does have the potential for humour. However I've decided to spice it up a little to make it more obvious, and into something that would earn the Star Letter position (if there is one): I was wandering around TopShop the other day when I spotted myself. I was keen to get a closer look and crashed straight into the shop mirror, which sent me flying backwards whilst slowly circling my arms. I tumbled dramatically into a clothes rail which turned out to be Simon Cowel. On second thoughts, there is no way to rewrite this story to Star Letter material (even after considering adding LOLs everywhere and coming up with the totally sensical and great acronym (seriously, my spelling is usually better than this): LO-LA [laughing out lower abdomen]). Maybe with another situation. But that's for another time. BUT there is time and potential to create a Star Letter by Frankensteining the other letters, presenting:
  • The band I sing in was wandering around TopShop in my maths lesson. Recently the netball team started flirting with my crush Matt. The stylist was at a friend's party and wanted to impress everyone to kill time from the buffet. A fit guy was messing around with my mobile phone when I was dancing in front of a hot guy who spotted a girl wearing a gorgeous pair of shoes, revealing my ancient off-white bra! Not only was he [then] in scolding pain, he was also soaking wet. He didn't look too impressed and moved to another carriage at home for privacy. Last week it was raining and I slipped and landed in everyone. Even my burning monsters and ghosts kept jumping out dressed as a zombie, making me scream and grab my teacher's hand. After a while I realised why they were staring at me: my pink boob tube had fallen down in what I thought was a seductive way. Eww! The audience howled with laughter. I have too much time on my hands. Actually, I have too little time and should be working. Must dash!

I've been playing with a metal belt for a little while now and I've just realized it's turned one of my hands grey.

This has been the most productive thing I've done all day.

Here's hopin' those resolutions are going strong. Hey, my laptop did wander out of my room (admittedly not of its own accord) and I have a computer instead. It was weird at first, and I still want to change the screen size, but all the computer space is delicious. I realize that sounds strange, but think of all the stuff (i.e: green day vids) I can put on here :D Plus I can get back to burnin' discs. Though, at the same time it has some fault which hasn't been figured out yet. Also: My room is in such a mess even I am thinking I have to tidy it. Usually I just criticize others inability and lack of flexiblity about getting around it. Tomorrow I shop as if the world is a CD, and I a broken cd player, lasering out my only my favouriterist tunes with as much charge as has been... charged. Then some day I will take that line and put it into a poem as a beautiful, beautiful metaphor.

I'm half tired and vaguely regretful. I did have an interesting yester-24-hours. I drank too much also. My computer got taken out of my room for a few days so I couldn't really get on the internet. I did get another laptop though so I could play games on it in place. Good times. Really. And I might be swapping this laptop for my actual computer later if I get everything more organised and whatever. I had a great Christmas; I might take some not-so-great-quality photos with my phone later for presents I received as I remembered recently I have a device for moving the images onto my comp lying around. And people were nice about the presents I gave so that was excellent! Also, I love the usual film splurge that happens around this time (well, a little earlier). Now I just want to avoid the entire world - or at least unrelated people I know, submerge myself in a wonderful winter world and dance around. But I do have stupid homework. But I can avoid that for at least a couple more days!

Why did one of my lovehearts say "Happy Birthday"? I am feeling a very tiny amount of sickliness from all the sweet products I have been consuming, and yet I do not stop. I have the strong urge to draw all over my bedroom walls. We shall see what comes of that. My original likening for Blink 182 has been deepening recently due to me seeing more footage and replaying Riding in Vans with Boys over and over and seemingly over and over and over and so on. I really start to like bands when I find out more about the people actually in them... But it all kind of sucks since they split up ages ago. *waves flag for them to forgive, forget and get back together* And now to watch Green Day. Whooo! :D

Dear Santa...

Dear Santa,

This year I've been busy!

In October I put money in 's expired parking meter (14 points). In June I farted in an elevator (-6 points). In March I saved a busload of nuns in Angola (326 points). Last Monday on a flight to LA, I stole the emergency flight information card (-40 points). Last Saturday I helped hide a body (-173 points).

Overall, I've been nice (121 points). For Christmas I deserve a pony!

Sincerely,
catchadrift

Write your letter to Santa! Enter your LJ username:
This is in ridiculous good timing as I was just trying to convince one of my friends to buy me a pony today!

YES. I ordered it a few days ago - came today and I've watched it and yesyesyes.

Mmmm. Green Day. :)

There is a squiggly line in my mind of uncertainty about things I should be organised for. I am also avoiding other stuff, which really is never a good idea, and the one thing I'm trying to be caring and excited for, someone keeps trying to bring me down about even though they should appreciate it most and I don't know if I can be bothered. We did the two minute silence today and it was almost surreal to have even the most likely offenders of noise shutting up in respect. I think only one person said something like, "One minute." But he is a stupid dork and so hence, anything he says shall be striked from history and no record of his existence ever mind. Ta-dah.
Whilst searching for poppies I also discovered: Poppy - a virtual organism. I am intrigued... Yet not enough to actually download this thing or whatever so far.

Aha, that waving umbrella amused me greatly.

*grin*

The audience wasn't loud enough the first time he wanted them to sing, and less Craig David, more Green Day would have been nice :)

But, yeah, I'm glad I didn't miss any of it - I only just managed to catch them announcing their performance was starting in time, wahey :)

P.S: Westlife suck.
(Sorry to any fans).
P.P.S: More Green Day at the end is great, even if it's only a bit. Thank yew TOTP. But the whole, tune in for the other episodes to see the rest of the 'mini gig' is going to be difficult with my forgetfulness. *gets to work writing down the times everywhere*

Well, I read the Metal Hammer Green Day issue! I skimmed on a few bits just analyzing stuff. It was pretty good, I'd say, with the photos and oodles about the band. There was one article which referred to "Billy Joe" a couple of times though, and a bunch of facts were wrong. But definitely Green Dayalicious.

Ooooooh. I went to and read the posts about Bullet in a Bible. Guh. I wish I hadn't. I wish it was here nooooow! I have no idea if it's possible to go to the cinema to see it there, and I haven't brooched the subject with anyone that could possibly, possibly take me as of yet... And the DVD is not out soon enough. Need... Now. Now, now, now. That is all. P.S: I'm hungry.

Today I listened and watched as someone I knew measured something out with a ruler, flipping it over two and a half times. This fact alone would of course not be shocking, or remotely interesting, but coupled with what she was referring to it could only lead to the half bemused/half wtf-ly stated fact, "That's a lie. You are wrong. That is not possible." Which she debated by saying it was because she had seen it. I know she isn't talking about her boyfriend; I know that's just about the first person she's ever gotten intimato with (only metaphorical vegetables involved), and apparently she has a huge aversion to porn and has (unsuccessfully) banned her significant other from it. So, this concludes to me, that ... I dunno. We suspect her group of friends (focused around now-boyfriend's mates), as they have always had a special relationship in their clan. It doesn't matter anyway because we concluded it was 'a curse rather than a gift', and then she started talking about ropes and pulleys.

Time travel seemed so much in my grasp, until I realized it was just the clocks going back.

I'll update more about the Halloween party latergaters :D

Today was basically fine except for one blip I won't go into. I hate messing up. It wasn't entirely my fault by far, but I still feel bad. 

There's something sinister and disturbing seeing a small bat sized shadow fly around your room a few days ago, and just now seeing it again. I suppose it's a moth somehow flying by the light in a way to make the overly large shape... But I can't locate any bug. Or, at least, I hope this isn't a first sign of madness. I am smelling burnt weetabix after all for no reason... Unless it's a sign that something mechanical is overcooking and I'm just not picking up on it. Ooh, or the fact I should tidy up.

I really liked the theme of the most recent PostSecret. I know it came out a fair number of days ago now, and I saw it then but forgot to mention it till now. On a few more random notes: Things are pretty confusing at points, and at others, they just give you a happy feeling. My mouth is orange after eating a lolly and it looks quite strange; I hope it's gone by the time I have to go out later. I cannot wait for half-term. Or getting loads of Pumpkins.

Seeeriously... Downloads not downloading are upsetting. I'll try again later. Eeeh. I want to kick the site. But that's not really possible without harming the laptop, which I don't want to do... Maybe I should settle for just remembering about pushing my friend into the mud. But that was a game. We're not violent people. Though, it probably appeared as though we were being pretty mean to other people watching... Whateveeeeer OTHER PEOPLE APPEAR MEAN TO ME ANYWAYZ. Except, not all of the time. We're probably going into Witness Relocation and Protection after providing a statement on some wrongdoers that didn't directly involve us. If I disappear... There you go then. Of course, this is merely school life. It's not as bad as at one of our friend's who took a trip down from hers and told us they set the bus on fire when new people came or something. Wha...? You know what, I'm still upset about the dream I had about the spree, much like that show I used to watch and love when I was younger (Supermarket Spree, or something?), which could have gotten me free stuff. I mean, I got the (ONE?!) doughnut and baguette at the bakery and then LOADS of bottle lamps. Like ten. I sort of woke up then, but let myself continue, and I went to next shops make-up isle and got all the expensive stuff, and apparently had a credit card given to me for the spree. And I got loads of heavy stuff. So I "borrowed" a trolley because by then I guess I must have had ten chickens. And then I went to Schuh. And told them all to get as many shoes (cue me pointing and pointing at various converse and trainer types) as they could in size 5 1/2 to 6 because I couldn't remember my actual shoe size. I'm sure glad I had the trolley else I might not have got back in time to the road where the imposter pregnant lady stood, and the old me who was grumpy at not knowing who the real impersonator was, now being cheerful and welcoming me back.

Argh, I remembered it and everything but still missed the first five minutes of the video.

What I saw... Hmm, I don't really know if I can comment that well since I missed such a big portion. I hadn't really thought about any of the characters before, since I didn't even get the American Idiot album until recently, though I'd listened to it before, but still they didn't really suit them to me. I wasn't expecting anything, and yet I still felt that way. I was glad Green Day were sort of there at least. But I'd need to watch it again, in full, and it'd probably grow on me more.

Uncomfortableness has reached a high today. But you've just got to endure, I suppose! As if having some sort of random stomach ache all the way through PE and a bit before, as well as randomly feeling sick here and there (though, I never throw up so I don't have to worry about that), was not enough, I felt as if everyone was out to tackle me to the ground in revenge for something I'd done to them in a previous life. Maybe I'm exaggerating. Okay, I am exaggerating, but, one of my friends bumped into the other one while she was standing next to me, and she's the sort of person to just... Go down. But she tried to stop herself, sort of, by grabbing onto me. Really, clinging, it kinda hurt but that wasn't the main thing on my mind. I was stumbling, trying to stand upright while she pulled me down. She kept pulling after she was on the ground. So, naturally I fell too after some more stumbling. Got up sharpish, and helped her up a moment later. Luckily, no one noticed because they were all too busy crowding around a hate letter to our Headteacher. Which the supply didn't mind, just letting them know they had 2 more minutes to work on it. It would be a bad move for me to parade around talking the wonders about our headteacher, since anyone can tell she's not the friendliest person ever, but she is good for the school. I mean, guh, can people not see that? The worst she's done is to stop our year hanging around town like they used to at lunch times if they got a pass - you have to go home like everyone else. That kind of sucked, since it would have been the first year a lunch pass would have interested me. Later, during the PE lesson, I was marking this boy in Netball, when we later played a mini-game which was quite good since our team was all girls and we were passing great and just generally winning all of it, after the teacher instructed me and another girl to run out then back for the ball, I got all prepped to do it, and as soon as the whistle blew, I went out and the boy RAN INTO ME. Really. Hard. And he did it on purpose. At first I was just thinking, "What...?" because, who runs into someone in a non-contact game. Thankfully, my gathered running power or whatnot, just meant it was like running against a wall, without falling over, so I wasn't embarrassed. A little peeved off that no one noticed, and we couldn't get some sort of penalty for it, but other than that OK. And sometime before that in the lesson, one of the other boys interrupted to tell the teacher a man over there *points past wire fences a few hundred metres away* was recording us. That was creepy. Everyone turned to stare, and the man sure enough was holding a camera phone which probably took videos. He wasn't directing it at us by then at least, I caught him sort of moving a little to turn and aim to take a picture of a car. At first, since I hadn't really heard what was going on, I thought the boy might have said something about him being suspicious and stealing from a car, trying to figure out whether that connected with taking pictures of it. Everyone watched as he got into his car, backed up a little, not sure whether he was waiting for us to look away before coming out again. No one did, of course. The teacher didn't say anything either, she was just watching. Everyone stared as he left. It was just one of those 'Huh' moments. The teacher didn't say much about it, except to clarify he was recording the group with the boy, and I guess she was just more weary about whoever stood there. Wowza, I can drag out a teeny portion of the day. Because this day was interesting to me, I'm bolding certain parts so YOU will be drawn towards it. I also stayed after school till almost 5pm to do some work which I need to hand into tomorrow, and made a very full page. But not one that needs to be in tomorrow.

I need to take more care. Apparently our Maths teachers attended some sort of picnic and managed to discuss all of us, despite me being able to pass for the Invisible role in class, or at least, and most definitely in that one, the I-don't-really-know-your-name-so-I'm-going-to-take-a-stab-at-it-and-get-it-wrong girl. This led to me et mon amie being told we'd be better if we focused more. After he was done telling us to which we couldn't help but politely agree, I tried to convince ma copine to follow her ruler's movements. I didn't realise I was proving the teachers point, whilst he was there (talking to another amie in front of us), until she told me. Hee. A bunch of people noticed I dyed my hair and mentioned it. The comments were pretty much overall good, or at least not bad. I was expecting some teasing since it's school after all. The worst I got was one boy saying first I'd dyed my hair a bit red, then orange to which I said I had rubbed an orange over it and I supposed he rubbed a lemon over his (it was a boy who dyed his hair some sort of crazy yellow in what one would suspect was a drug induced urge). Then he (yes, he did keep circling the room... Many, many times...) named it ginger. But, I can't say I was offended by anything he said, it wasn't really mean. But as for others; that's only the first day. Who knows about tomorrow. *dances* Another day of avoiding all the serious coursework I have to do. I suck. LOLLIPOPS. Maybe I will encourage myself to do some work by lighting a candle. They put me in a blackout-hmm?-maybe-I-should-do-something-productive mood.

I'm trying to persuade people to lend me $20 or preferably a credit card so I can join the Green Day Idiot Club. Enthusiasm seems to be lacking in response however. It does strike me as ... odd? Stingy? that the band would make you pay to see all these things. I bet when they were younger they wouldn't have paid that for it, especially if they lived in a different country with a different currency. But, at the same time, I'm not insulting them because they're still my favourite band and I'm kidding myself if I say I don't really, really want to sign up even if it means paying. Plus, on a vaguely related matter, the subject of allowance will now be considered pour moi. I suggested a trial basis, whilst still working out the kinks and whatnot. I think I deserve more money. Yes, money money money. Then I could take my allowance, and hand some dosh over to my parents (aka credit card owners) and get them to offer up the details for ze Green Day club. And, even though I've been told that I won't have money for them all the time, since allowance is to buy everything, unlike pocket money, I can't help but think of all the new trainers I can get. I love trainers.

This is tiring.

My thumb is sore, sometimes, when I press down the tip. Managed to obtain a cut from flowers I believe.

I'll type up the apparently solution-solving meeting I had to go to after school later. It just made me more tired. The two teachers, not involved but 'helping', or witnessing or whatever, didn't exactly bring up the subjects we wanted. We had to do that, and even then never got to say what we really thought.
Walking later, probably. *nod* If you love Mike Myers, maybe even Kanye West and a little controversy is your cup of tea, I thoroughly reccommend going here. Shoo be do do do.

Today was pretty boring in most respects, but good in my personal opinion. I love relaxing, and I'm almost certain I'll be out tomorrow so I can't be accused of a lazy streak either. Now I'm going to attempt to convince myself to do homework. Yes I am. I must. Yes. Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes. Here we go! Maybe. Here I go. Yes. Off to do homework. Staying in the same place! Okay then. Hommmmework! I'm really going to do some now. I'll be back though. I think I'll be back before I've left (though staying in the same place as it involves the computer), and then back after I [haven't] left. Keep telling yourself that makes sense. It'll sink in.

Bwoh, it was just pouring it down a minute ago, and I can still hear the slooshing of puddles as cars drive past. I love rain, oh so mucho. Sadly, I cannot go and dance in it or the thundery sounding goodness, for I will probably not be allowed, and due to the fact I am not dressed well enough to do so, though in trying to change that fact it does beg the question how do you dress for rain? I feel a swimming costume would attract too many strange looks. I must research this.

Mm, this ice is good. I can't believe I haven't been having more ice recently. ICE ALL THE WAY FROM NOW ON. Including other stuff... Especially since my family is encouraging me to get a takeaway for some obscure reason. In fact, I refused one this evening, because I just wasn't hungry, and yet the options were all there, for favourites or otherwise. Some sort of conspiracy to make me gain weight, hm? Though I believe it was only yesterday I had a takeaway again! Madness! And a long time ago an ex-friend made me a Best hits of Reel Big Fish CD, which I've never looked after very carefully like many of my burnt CDs, and was playing recently. It was fine after all the time sitting exposed, but then it's in the hi-fi for one day and next thing I know it's covered in scratches and some of the later songs go all sort of funny. I've cleaned it to no avail. Eeeh. But I know it's not the hi-fi. It's just nonsensical and some sort of mad fluke that it could work beforehand with the marks. In other news: More gold from X Factor. I hate it when they beg to them to pass through though - just wait and see what they say. They're not going to be more convinced but your desperate pleas as soon as you've finished singing.

Just proving I can be up before lunch time.

(Not the first time either, but I'm usually up before then so I can get ready to go out, but we cancelled the trip ^^).
I really should just go to sleep. I'm bored. This entry is completely pointless. I'll add to it tomorrow, er, later on today, I guess.

I wanted to go shopping today, but then I couldn't... Don't mind, I s'pose. The room tidying is still happening. I wish I had a bigger room. At least after this I might be able to paint my room (not counting the three tester splodges from months ago). Right now I'm onto 'glue broken stuff' stage. Ruler right now. I'd better fill in some work experience details actually. Eurgh, it's so long and tedious and I probably should have done it whilst I was working. Whoa. Watching Supernanny and talk about bratty kids! Y'know, it's a wonder with all those children like that out there why I'm not appreciated more and given the big bedroom in the house. Or some sort of fan because I am BOILING. Is it weird that watching their behaviour makes me wish I had a kid so I could prove I'd be good at keeping him/her in line? The heat is getting to me, apparently.

Browsing greenday_daily (forgive me, I do not know the coding to make that link to the community, even though I wish I did, but at the same time am not feeling like searching for it, even if it's only a couple of clicks away. Logic, much?) when I saw someone make the post about Billie's crazy little spiel about owning a bicycle/scooter/whatnot and a worry stone. Man, I wish I had a worry stone. Except, his made him go insane, quite obviously.

I'm so glad I didn't get rid of Realplayer (was considering it, since I need SPACE, and have the other player that works with the same files...) since I could save it to that. Crazy Billie is good to have around - I think the way he waggles his fingers so fast is slightly hypnotising...

I don't really have anything to say. How boring.

Got rained on. Still good though. Bounced tennis balls.

No tennis racket.

I must find more of these French bubblegum tattoos, which require no water to put on. Though the pig came out wrinkly.

Anthony won, mmhmmm. Fireworks, mmmmmmmm. It was good. Davina was a bit nasty to Makosi - the pregnancy thing was bad, but she wasn't the worst housemate and she was definitely interesting. They should have had more flashbacks to Maxwell - or when Maxwell and Anthony were teasing Craig in the box, that was fun-ny. The drink throwing and yelling was good - didn't see those episodes, or the kitten one (meow miaow meow).

Why am I coming on now, eh? Big Brother's just starting, and I'm an avid watcher harhar (most of the time, sort of... It's gotten a bit boring since ol' Maxwell left). Just, please... I hope Eugene doesn't win. He took the money, which I just thought was unfair of the whole idea to even be there in the first place. Plus, I thought he was Super Moral Man? It's too difficult to accept scones and tea, but not this? I know there's a huge difference, but I think he would have probably won anyway if he'd refused it. So... DON'T WIN NOW. He deserves to lose. He got his payment, he seemed like a super nice guy but there've been murmurings under his breath, showing not only is he "Oh, yeah, human..." but actually, a little bit sinister... I certainly don't act like that, and wouldn't want to know someone who does. If you have a problem with someone you have a normal argument or don't try to hide it or say straight out insults quietly! Plus; boring. INCREDIBLY BORING. Almost to the point of unfunniness that he's funny... But I don't see it. Others say it, but it certainly doesn't make me laugh. I've met people similar to that in real life and it makes me feel uncomfortable because I always try and politely laugh. I thought it was stupid when that ooooooother suuuuuuuuuuuuper boring Cameron guy won it however long ago, SO DON'T SUPPORT ANOTHER BORINGO. I have no idea who I'm talking to. I'm just worried he's going to win. Even though it doesn't really matter as a key issue in relation to everything else. It really sucks, 'cause the British public seem to latch onto some of the worst characters - I remember another guy, Jaaaason (me and my friends were just talking about it yesterday), who was so HORRIBLE and GRUMPY and he was there until... Uh, last three I think. Unbelievable. Since I'm English, I'm under the impression we're great (like other nationalities of course, except I don't watch their Big Brother... But I bet they don't keep MIND NUMBINGLY BORING no matter how sweet they may appear with mousey cheese nibbling teeth-people in), and... Too cool to vote for these people. Now, we don't vote, but if we did I can assure you it would be for someone else. Probably Makosi if I had any say, because yes she's some sort of compulsive liar or something, but that makes her much more interesting, if a little crazy. Stopping going on now, so I can catch the rest. DON'T WIN DON'T WIN DON'T WIN EUUUUUUUUUUBORRRRE. I can see it coming. I hope it doesn't.

*skies in*

Hola again :D

Proper update in Friends Only, and not because it's truly interesting either.

I'm off on Holiday now (or around now). Hopefully we've got all that's needed, and the food there will be good, and I'll find North Atlantic Ferry Tacklers (I've found it increasingly difficult over the years, getting the best supply when we stayed in a resort, though the best was from a snackbar where they substituted seal spinach with some sort of wonderful lettuce sauce).

Three weeks, then I'll be back... And maybe before that, if internet can be found :) <3 <3 <3

Well, knit me a new sweater - evolution strikes again; Ducks necks are getting bendier. I declare it. Credit if proposing a documentary and/or scientific investigation into the 'fact'. :P Holidays start soon! Edit: Today someone forcefully jabbed a pin into my hand (one that goes with the security tags at the store). By someone however, I mean me. And by 'forcefully jabbed' I mean I was squeezing the bag I had used for tagging to make sure I had emptied them all, and I hadn't. Ouch.

HAAAAAAAR. I'ma gonna getta some foodies soon. Also have the Harry Potter book, at last. It must last me at least the next three days however, as I need something to do(/read) at lunchtimes at work. Mmhm, save eating the sausage roll/cone of chips (probably leaning on chips more often since the Bakery ladies must hate me for holding up the line so much for a battle of, "No you go first", "No you". I won... One out of two times. We shall see about the next ;) Though I'll try to avoid it, honest. Hmm. I forgot today my account was no longer a paid account. But... The layout is still the same, so, so very much love for that fact (*wishes that it won't magically change*). Three icons seems so small now - I couldn't remember it was only three ;_______; But, for all the fun and greatness that it had while it lasted, I owe to . Who rocks, as if that wasn't obvious *nudges you*. P.S: I hope I coded that right. We shall see ;) NO! I didn't x) Fixing.

I almost forgot, the Harry Potter book came out today. Hmm, I want it, but can't pester my parents for a bit because I have a face pack on.

Hmm. I hope someone gets it eventually... If it isn't already sold out.

Hmmm. Probably is. Darn.

I hate people finishing it before me and wanting to talk about it.

I AM SO MEEEEEEEEELTTTTTTTTTING.

This heat... Too much... It looks like it could rain outside, and yet, so hot. 

*gasps* *slides slowly off chair*

Uh... No Nice Guys Finish Last video?

I'm sure I had that downloaded.

*sulks*

EDIT: Well, it's hard being a genius, but I now have it downloaded.

;D

Work experience was good, even though the manager of the store came up and purposely locked us out and said not a word. Another worker came along a bit later and was very friendly, and we found out the manager didn't realise we were coming (what? The school organised it all - you met with my friend in an interview!). Then after fetching some paperwork, it became only me who wasn't expected - in paperwork terms that is, but that was the school's fault. Still, everyone there seems very nice and friendly. Organising things seems to be somewhat of a calling in my life. My room; an absolute tip. That store; wonderfully tagged, bagged and ready to go.

Hmm, well, still the lack of overly tiredness boggles me. I woke up earlier than usual, not feeling tired at all, but continued to stay in bed for hours because I am just that lazy. And as I found when getting up, it's incredibly hot and unbearable. But oh well, approximately 11 days from now I will be in France, no work to do at all - not even work experience, which begins tomorrow.

I'm feeling tired now, properly so, at last. :) Snooze time.

I wish I could add something else to this, but eh. :P

Today in the afternoon, me and two friends made a film. I thought for once we wouldn't argue, since the real arguer of the group seemed to have calmed down after the lesson previously where I got agitated and told her basically to stop picking fights. But after figuring out I hadn't fully figured out my camera, and then re-figuring it out and figuring it out that I still hadn't figured out everything and figuring we had to start again, I wasn't in the mood to sellotape on my fake beard once more and attempt the psychiatrist scenes, with Larky seemingly not knowing when to stop and get the best shot. I'll admit, I was a completely terrible camera woman, but I knew when to stop, and didn't have to wait for gestures from the actresses! But anyway, I really enjoyed directing, though only doing one very small role got snide comments from arguement-girl once again, who we can't kick out of our group or anything since she's a friend and would have nowhere else to go, and then there'd just be two of us. She's not a bad person, just quite grouchy and moody. Well, too bad anyway - I was just going to continue being the camera woman! And I did so, and my directions did not work too well as they seemed unable to shape their faces into the needed emotions and grinned when they were meant to be terrified, but it wasn't a bad thing I suppose since it was meant to be a comedy at the core of it all <3 The end result: humorous. Difficult to understand, and bad camera handling and scene backgrounds, but ultimately good, even if some were slow off the bat/cue to do what they were meant to, and one certain should-be-killer had to be instructed to chase the victim, turning around and asking at the very end. Ah, yes :)

I'm feeling decidedly more chirpy even after an annoying day, which wasn't so bad, except for the unexpected and shocking end, which I think we all handled quite well but won't get into. But anyway, now everything is good and well and tomorrow is a new day! I've written a looong complaint letter about a member of staff at our school, as has my friend, and our parents and we'll be handing it all in tomorrow :)

Summer holidays, roll around for me. I can't even take the work experience any more, the thought it pains me, can't you see? I'm tired of all the exams, even though they've been and gone, and everyone's being grouchy and a total waste of space - except the friends I call friends. Oooh, tired, tired! I'm too tired to stay up late, and I'm too tired in the morning. The summer and the sitting and the working and the weather and the everything, it all makes me tired.
